verses.verse: (Parental Advice) (Prov 1.8; 2.2) Listen, children, to a father’s instruction, and be attentive, that you may gain (Heb know) insight,
for I give you good precepts: do not forsake my teaching.
(1 Chr 22.5) When I was a son with my father, tender and my mother’s favorite,
(1 Chr 28.9; Prov 7.2) he taught me and said to me, “Let your heart hold fast my words; keep my commandments and live.
(v 7|PRO 4:7; Prov 16.16) Get wisdom; get insight: do not forget nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
(2 Thess 2.10) Do not forsake her, and she will keep you; love her, and she will guard you.
(Prov 23.23) The beginning of wisdom is this: get wisdom, and whatever else you get, get insight.
(1 Sam 2.30) Prize her highly, and she will exalt you; she will honor you if you embrace her.
(Prov 1.9) She will place on your head a fair garland; she will bestow on you a beautiful crown.”
(Admonition to Keep to the Right Path) Hear, my child, and accept my words, that the years of your life may be many.
(1 Sam 12.23) I have taught you the way of wisdom; I have led you in the paths of uprightness.
(Ps 18.36; Prov 3.23) When you walk, your step will not be hampered, and if you run, you will not stumble.
Keep hold of instruction; do not let go; guard her, for she is your life.
(Ps 1.1; Prov 1.15) Do not enter the path of the wicked, and do not walk in the way of evildoers.
Avoid it; do not go on it; turn away from it and pass on.
(Ps 36.4; Mic 2.1) For they cannot sleep unless they have done wrong; they are robbed of sleep unless they have made someone stumble.
For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
(2 Sam 23.4; Isa 26.7; Dan 12.3) But the path of the righteous is like the light of dawn, which shines brighter and brighter until full day.
(Job 18.5; Isa 59.9, 10; Jer 23.12; Jn 12.35) The way of the wicked is like deep darkness; they do not know what they stumble over.
My child, be attentive to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.
(Prov 3.21; 7.1, 2) Do not let them escape from your sight; keep them within your heart.
(Prov 3.8; 12.18) For they are life to those who find them and healing to all their flesh.
(Mt 12.34; Mk 7.21; Lk 6.45) Keep your heart with all vigilance, for from it flow the springs of life.
(Prov 6.12; 19.1) Put away from you crooked speech, and put devious talk far from you.
Let your eyes look directly forward and your gaze be straight before you.
(Ps 119.5; Heb 12.13) Keep straight the path of your feet, and all your ways will be sure.
(Deut 5.32; 28.14; Prov 1.15) Do not swerve to the right or to the left; turn your foot away from evil.
